description:
Thai milk tea was very consistent with what you find elsewhere at boba places. Nothing particularly special to write home about. However, consistency is important when you're looking at a boba place.

This place is open pretty late by comparison to the other boba places on San Bruno Ave. 

My experience has always been that it has decent to good service.
author: Michael C.

description:
This should be no star.

Hi Tea Plus management,

I went in to order a crystal yogurt, one of your new drinks. I waited 10 mins or so, a couple went in and ordered some red drink. A few more minutes went by, and the couple got their drink, then your staff tells me that you don't gave the crystal yogurt available. It took her 15 minutes and worked on someone else's order before she could tell me-- I wasted my time for nothing. Retrain your employees or not because I WILL NEVER GO BACK.
author: V B.

description:
Complete utter garbage. Late delivery due to long preparation. (Even the Postmates guy had to apologize to me in their behalf). Wrong boba in my tea. And the worst part is their fried snacks.

Everything is SOGGY!!  Looks like they microwaved previous fried food. ALL of them. The fries, the potsticker the curly fries, the spring roll.

Guys. Just. Don't. Waste of my 15$ on that mega snackbox.
author: Adiputra L.

description: Drink was alright. Service was horrible. I went in to get a drink and my drink came with a lecture... I saw a drink on the poster on their wall and it looked really good so I decided to order that. No one was at the cash register so I tried to look through the curtains to see if there were anyone inside to help me. A guy came out (possibly the owner) to take my drink order. I told him I want that drink on the poster and he said ok. Then he asked me what toppings I would like. The poster said it came with aloe vera. Confused, I asked him if it already came with aloe vera and he said no. I said to him that it says with aloe vera... He told me that it's just a poster and then said to me that if you go buy a car at the dealership based on seeing a catalog, you would still have to add this and that... I thought to myself, am I here for a drink or a lecture? He kept going on and on and then asked me if I still want the aloe vera. He says its extra charge. I said yes... Although their poster is false advertisement, it wasn't a big deal to me. I didn't mind paying extra for aloe vera, I was just a little surprised that it didn't come with aloe vera when it says with aloe vera. I wasn't trying to cause a scene or anything. He asked me how sweet and I said 50% then he went to the back to make my drink. He brought out a little sample to see if I liked the taste or the sweetness and I said to him that it's a little too sweet for me. He seemed annoyed and said to me that if I come back and order from another cashier, I should ask for no sweet first and then add the syrup afterwards. He went inside to revise the drink a little and came back out with another sample. At that moment, I just wanted to get out of there. I said to him that it's better and I'll just take it. I paid for the drink and then he asked me if I wanted a stamp card. I said to him, "No, thanks!" I was not planning on coming back.
author: B L.

description:
This place is so awful!!! If I could give this place negative stars I would! The tea is garbage! The food is even more garbage! And I f you want to try and mask the garbage taste, you can't because they don't even have any sauces to accompany their fried, greasy garbage! The customer service is garbage! I was craving boba so I ordered from here a couple weeks ago using Uber eats and when I received it, it triggered an angry response. I wasted money and time and then had to re-order and wait longer or food that was actually edible. The fact that this place would serve food in the way they do is just a disgrace! 

I ordered a honeydew boba tea. I received something that tasted somewhat like coffee with some melon flavor in it. It was so awful and instantly dumped down the drain!

I ordered some super app combo. It was supposed to come with chicken wings, mozzarella sticks, curly fries, regular fries, spring rolls and jalapeño poppers. It was served in a 6 inch box in which half the items were lost in a greasy deep fried mess! It's as if they threw all of these items into one fryer together and then tossed it straight into a 6 inch box that it didn't fit in. I opened it and attempted to pick up a curly fry and the rest of the fried greasy crap came with it. It was so disgusting! Half of the items didn't even seem to be in there but to be honest I wouldn't know if they were because I'de never get that far. It was inedible and this place should be ashamed of itself! I hope they close soon because they have no passion for what the hell they're doing!
author: Aleisha T.

description:
I opt to try this place out because bff lived nearby and they have lavender milk tea - their telephone works and that's always a plus for me haha

They have 3 sizes:
small - 16oz
medium - 20oz to 24oz tall cup versus the chubby cup
large - 32oz bucket

Lavender MT was pre-made but at least not grainy, quality would be subpar, similar to a Quicklys. total for a large with not topping ~ $4
author: Yeanne L.

description:
This is a terrible restaurant. I ordered three items on Ubereats with a coupon. But in the end they just delivered one item without letting me know it beforehand. Very very very disappointed!
Also based on my past experience, the food and milk teas are very low quality, don't waste you money here!
author: Kkkl Z.

description: This place NEVER HAS ANYTHING ON THE MENU & THE WAIT IS TERRIBLE !!! Not only did the prices go up but it takes about 25mins before you get your drink!! The owner constantly says that he uses natural fruits but that's not the case you can taste the powder he's super nice but he definitely needs to be more organized!!! Every time I come in he says the same thing he runs out of ingredients all the time and that he uses natural fruit! I ordered mango smoothie and a banana smoothie it took about 25+ minutes until I got them I ordered spam with rice it was terrible as you can see in the pictures it had more rice than spam /or sauce. When you look at the menu you think you're ordering something that cost four dollars which are actually ordering something that cost six dollars he hasn't updated the menu and I've been going here for months now same story each time. I think Is going to be the last time I ever go and order with them only because anything I wanted to order on the menu they didn't have once again plus they basically gave me a container of rice overall my experience tonight was super super shitty I don't think I'll ever be returning I'm still thinking about it it's sucks because I actually really like the place the owner and the people he has working for them but I just feel like he has a lot of organizing to do!! With that said I'll just play it by ear next time whether or not I want to return to TEA PLUS.....
author: Lei S.

description:
Decided to come here because it was the most rated near by. Ordered popcorn chicken and it was undercooked. Spoke to the person who cooked it, he asked if I wanted it re-fried??? He show my reaction and instead gave me my refund.

Never coming back here again... hate places the can't even cook chicken well. Especially, if it is just popcorn chicken.
author: Johanna M.

description:
Tasty but, really dirty establishment. Looks like they never clean the tables. Definitely not the floors. 
Gross!
author: Eksel P.

description:
I came here for the first time today, milk tea was very low quality. I planned on a quick visit (like most people do when they go to a boba place) and waited 20 minutes for my popcorn chicken without notice is was going to take so long. The owner said thank you for waiting (which I appreciated hearing) and I said thank you back then quickly rushed out because I had to be somewhere. He obviously did not hear me say thank you back, and on my way out the door he sarcastically yelled at me "YOU'RE WELCOME!" First off, I DID say thank you back. And second off, even if I didn't, how childish are you to yell and be upset at a customer who waited so long without notice due to YOUR slow service?!
I also tipped the employees twice before I received my food.
author: Kaylee V.

description:
Nope!

I ordered with Postmates and just no. 

First off, one of my drinks was missing. Now, I don't know if this mistakes lies with my courier or the actual shop. Nonetheless, it's missing. 
Second, I ordered a peanut butter and banana crepe and it's the saddest pile of garbage I've ever seen (see attached photo). I also ordered a Thai tea which is edible but not the greatest by far. 

Never again ordering from or ever visiting this place.
author: Ney J.

description:
Out of all of the boba shops on the block this is the one I come to. The boba generally tastes better. I go here when I'm craving boba before walking home, when I'm catching up with friends, or before I go out. The owner of this place is also extremely nice and has great attitude towards his customers. He also gives out nice discounts once in a while.

When craving boba in San Bruno Ave this is the place to go to!
author: Erica L.

description:
They have lavender milk tea to order up as a specialty. Grass jelly wasn't good.  Stick with boba as topping.   

Decent spot to drop by and become hydrated from the heat on a rare SF day!

I like their snacks like curry fish balls and popcorn chicken! 

Limited seating.

I think one person was working everything...
author: Tiffany D.

description: service is bad just like everyone said it was. messed up my order after forgetting about it. go to omg or panda boba instead.
author: Jeyel G.

description:
This is probably the better of the two boba spots on the block. I've had the drinks at the other place and they all taste like water and powder.

The drinks here are of higher quality and they are pretty consistent. I've never had the snacks here though so I can't comment on that.

The owner is a super hard working guy who does his best to satisfy his customers. You can tell by his face that he stresses himself way too hard. He is constantly making improvements to his establishment however and it is beginning to look like a very legitimate boba shop! 

My only problem with the place is that it takes a long time to get my drinks. They are understaffed a lot of the time so if you have time, then I would get a drink here instead of the other place.
author: Samuel W.

description:
This place is odd. The interior is rather so-so, and my friend had remarked that the kitchen looked pretty dirty.

The service is nice though. They give you coupons depending on the $ amount that you spend. The bubble tea is about $3.

The bubble tea itself is not too bad. I liked my boba. However my boyfriend's grass jelly was quite hard, and he was disappointed with the quality. We also got the potato croquettes which were tasty but $6 for three. I also saw them take them out of the freezer (which is fine it itself, but I guess the food is not handmade), and it took them awhile to make the croquettes.
author: Danielle C.

description: I love this spot. Everyone is supe friendly and the best part is that everything is fresh since they use real ingredients in their drinks. Ordered an avocado smoothie and it was so good. The popcorn chicken is amazing too. Perfectly crispy, super tasty and cooked to perfection. I'll be returning again.
author: Veronica S.

description: Late review: This place I think open about two years  or over right next to 5 degree boba place. I was like wow competition. This place is also ok like 5 degree but earn half star more because it has crystal boba ( some places call it agar jelly or crystal pearl) and their tea press tea is pretty good with strong tea flavor. Great options too. Overall 3.5 star. Oh service is ok hit or miss. The owner and this young kid gave good service but the owner wasn't too nice with his employee.  Maybe it's his son. Anyway. I enjoyed it here more than 5 degree but when I'm with my friend we hit up 5 degree for his coffee milk tea. Lucky they are both next to each other so satisfied both tastebud.
author: Christy V.

description:
If you grew up around San Bruno Ave, then you probably remember Quickly's being go-to the boba spot. Fast forward years later and now Quickly's is gone, but many tea places have opened up in the area since. Even the restaurants have boba! 

But, as many options as I have to choose from, Tea Plus is a definite go-to for me. The prices are great, the selection keeps expanding, and they're open later than the rest of the boba shops. I feel like every time I go there, there's something new and I love it. Loveee it I tell you. 

I even bring my visiting friends there if they're looking for a good milk tea place in the neighborhood, not to mention my coffee loving friends enjoy it too. So yeah, I'm there so much I practically live there LOL.

If you haven't gone, make sure you try it! And you'll probably catch me there while you're at it, among all the school kids and passerbyers. 

PS: you can also order from them on Postmates, Eat24, and UberEATS :D
author: Mauricia R.

description:
Late night craving for boba, this place is about 5 minutes from my house and one of the few open at this time. 

Wanted a quick transaction so I decided to order online. The EST time was 1 hour! So I called the store to see if that was correct and then they told me 30 minutes depending on if they were busy or not. It's 9 PM so I figured they wouldn't be slammed. Waited another 10 min and then left my house. When we got there and said we had a online order the guy asked me about 5 times if I had called the store. I said yes and he told me, "we told you to come in 30 minutes." It had already been 20 min since I called. MIND YOU, there's 1 person in there? So I didn't understand why the 2 drinks couldn't just be made real quick. I ordered a large Thai tea with regular tapioca & a small Thai tea with regular tapioca. He then gives me 2 smalls one with small tapioca. I didn't really care, just wanted my tea so I drove off. I take a sip of my drink and it's powder and large chunks of idk if it was like Thai tea powder or what but it wasn't pleasant. So now I drive back had them remake the drinks and I still didn't get the right boba in the drink.

I've been here plenty of times and never had a problem so idk if it's the people working at this time. Honestly didn't even drink it. Waste of time.
author: Val A.

description: I stopped in here today.  I got the iced strawberry tea with strawberry bits in it and mango pops.  The lady who took my order was nice repeated it back to me.  I sat and waited. The older gentleman came out and we chatted about the spicy curry fish ball eating challenge.  I asked how spicy is it. He told me it depends on the persons DNA.  I found that interesting.  I got my tea and carried on my way.  The tea was very good not too sweet very fresh.  The strawberries were cut perfectly diced.  The mango poppers are all juice fresh tasting.  The flavor is so awesome I loved it.  The large tea drinks are very big for 5bucks I got that yummy drink. I can't wait to stop in and try another flavor.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I ordered via UberEATS and it came fast! I ordered strawberry and Nutella with whipped cream and vanilla ice cream. The price is cheaper than most and the portions are very generous. By the way, I order the same crepe from 3 different restaurants through UberEATS as a "test", and this place is the best so far.
author: Rochelle B.

description: This is by far one of my favorite boba shops ever. I used to come here everyday back in high school and I had a lovely experience every time. The drinks and snacks here are super tasty plus they have a good amount of tables for people to sit and hang out. Julian the shop owner is very humble, he always strives to make his customers happy!
author: Kristine L.

description:
This place sucks. Drinks are tasteless and very bitter. I don't know if he's the owner, but there's this old guy working who's rude and dumb. 

I ordered milk tea. He said something but I couldn't understand his English, I said pardon and he looked at me saying original milk tea right, and I said yes. Looked at me like I was dumb. Then he asked me any toppings, I said no and shook my head, and then he asked me again any toppings, and again I said no. The second time he asked me "any toppings" he asked it slowly and had wide eyes thinking I don't understand or speak English and I didn't know anything. Not my fault his English is so bad!
author: Vanessa L.

description: Just ordered Uber eats from this establishment. Unfortunately, to my surprise, there was a hair ball and dirt found in my snack box. This is extremely unsanitary and disgusting. This is a hazard to people's health. Please fix this.
author: Alex C.

description: They take forever to make your drinks on top of that they have rude owners especially the old guy he mumbles so its hard to understand what he's saying. Even if you ask him to repeat. So I wouldn't recommend this place. Nor will I be ever returning.
author: Chaeyoung L.

description: Giving them a one star because I waited 45 mins for one order of popcorn chicken... it's terrible
author: Dexter T.

description: I don't wanna comeback here anymore! I called in for the pick up order like I usually doing because they are taking so long to make the items then the guy who answered my call was completely rude! So I changed mind to not getting it anymore! It's proven! My friend is always ordering the exact items! But oh my goodness!! Fix your attitude! I told you what I want then you kept asking me what kind of crepes! Sometimes, you gave us wrong items either!
author: Chloe M.

description: Service was quick. The woman was nice. The hot milk tea has a distinguish taste. Can't quite put my finger on it. The first sip.. I was like is this milk tea??! But after while it wasn't bad... would like to try their snacks next time.
author: Ann L.

description:
Meh same difference as 5 degrees next door except was super disappointed with popcorn chicken. There was a lot of breading and little chicken.

I sampled the tea of the day and it was overly sweet, trying to cover up that it was kind of overbrewed.
author: Mimi T.

description: Love this place! Always had a great experiece with the service and drinks. Fyi, Oreo milk tea with is the bomb
author: Alex G.

description: My brother ordered 3 tapioca drinks from Uber Eats and they only ended up dropping off 2 out of 3 and they didn't have boba like we ordered! Terrible customer service, Tea Plus. They should have at least called if they ran out of ingredients to save us time and money. We probably won't do business with them again!
author: Bianca B.

description: Great place my girlfriend and I come here all the time. It's a great place and the owner works very hard and makes sure the you're happy with your drink. Great prices for what you're getting. Oh yeah the Thai milk tea is a must try! They just remodeled so it looks a lot better than before too! Love this place
author: Nate P.

description:
They have a wide variety of boba drinks and snacks. Staff are friendly.

Took out 2 stars because of their restroom. Its dirty and had alot flies. Do not use the restroom unless you cannot control anymore.
author: April L.

description: Lavender milk tea tastes like those Chinese brown medicine heh.. I recommend letting it sit while the ice dilutes the flavor! But I wouldn't get this drink again. For $7, you get a small takeout of small popcorn chicken chunks. The drinks are really inexpensive for a small though! $2.75 for a small lavender milk tea and $2.50 for a small jasmine milk tea. I wouldn't recommend this place though. The drinks need to be consistent.
author: Sarah F.

description:
It was late during night at around 9 pm when I decided I wanted to try out the other nearby boba tea shop since 5 degrees was closed for the night. Mind you I always order Jasmin boba tea at 5 degrees because it taste awesome and it's my favorite boba drink to order when I'm craving for boba tea at night.

I ordered very late at night so I wasn't expecting a superb quality drink from Tea Plus but I just cannot disregard how disgusting the jasmine milk tea was. The drink was tasteless, and tasted somewhat bitter. I felt like I was drinking medicine. Also did I mention they ran out of the regular sized tapioca? Yeah...

DO NOT goto Tea Plus. The drink took more than 5 minutes to arrive but more importantly the drink was terrible. Save your money and goto 5 degrees.
author: Kevin C.

description: Nasty! Owner is weird and rude. The only reason why it gets two stars is because the menu has variety but the actually product tastes far from milk teas I've tried.
author: Adriana C.

description: I  always come back because of the owner he always looks out for the students that come in, such a community man. He's super friendly and I can always know he'll go above and beyond to make sure my drink and food is what I want. I wish more people would come his shop is open until 12 great for folks with the munchies.
author: Malika R.

description: Good tasting food, good vibes, and pretty chill milk tea for a late night place, I would also recommended eating the curry fish ball challenge if you're up for it! Quite a fun challenge if you've eaten around the 1 million scoville area and are up for a little burn!
author: David L.

description: Was in the area n got their eggettes, and jasmine milk tea w salty milk foam and boba. The boba was nice and chewy, and wasn't too sweet. The eggettes are Ok. Nothing too special but that owner was very nice. Talked a lot about the tea but glad to see he's passionate about his food and tea. If I'm ever in the area again, I'll try the popcorn chicken and fish balls since he said they make it fresh in house!
author: Linh G.

description:
Do I love this place? No. Do i hate it though? Definitely not. Boba consistency is spotty at best and sometimes it's a little dusty in there. 

Let's consider what it is though, super cheap boba, open late for a quick fix esp if you don't live in the sunset or Richmond district. Parking at night is a breeze, the people working there are usually friendly albeit they don't necessarily speak the most English. 

Here's the thing... THIS IS NOT A PLACE FOR ADVENTUROUS BOBA DRINKERS. You're not at boba guys or purple cow. Don't get too wild with your drink or you'll likely be disappointed. I get the same thing every time I come, jasmine milk tea with boba - I adjust the sweetness & ice every time as well. Sure I've had better jasmine milk tea elsewhere but honestly this one isn't bad. It 's 11:17pm on a Friday night. I got in & out in 2 minutes literally. Can't be mad at that. Also my drink was $3 so there's that too. 

Think of it in an optimistic manner, there's Mc Donald's on one hand, and in n out on the other. Mc Donald's is convenient, super cheap unless you get fancy w/ your order, and they're open late! In-n-out is what it is, bomb, with a ridiculously long wait, and closes before the club ends. Apples & oranges people.
author: Krystal B.

description:
Most disgusting milk tea I've ever encountered. I ordered the Rose Milk Tea w/Boba. It was straight up sour. I've had Rose Milk Tea at several different places and it has NEVER come out sour. When asking the cashier about the drink, she confirmed that it's supposed to be sour. That threw me off, I asked if I could trade it for a different drink because I couldn't drink it and she said no. WOW! Thanks a lot you just lost a potential frequent customer. We ordered a bunch of other snacks but they're not worth mentioning. If you enjoy fishing for broken, tiny pieces of curly fries they have them here. Should've stuck with our usually spot Five Degree Tea House a few doors down but wanted to try something new. What a big mistake.

It's been over an hour and still trying to get rid of the nasty taste left in my mouth.
author: D V.

description: I've always been ordering the same drink for numerous times (at least 20 times probably) and I never had a problem with that. In fact, it was always good and I always tip. This time, it took me a while trying to explain to that guy who took my order (I even typed it out for him on my phone and asked him to repeat the order.) He then made the drink three times and still couldn't get it right. After all, the taste of the final one I got was still off but I decided to leave with it because I spent too much time on ONE drink. Please tell me straight if you can't do it so I can order something else. Don't just randomly mix the syrup and tea together thinking your customers don't know s**t. I used to work at a milk tea place so that doesn't work on me. Plus I've ordered the same thing at this place for so many times. That drink is EASY AF. I hate giving out 1 star review but sorry boss, you REALLY have to train your employee right. Will NOT recommend this place to anyone unless you are okay to get something that doesn't taste like what you order at all.
author: Tina W.

description: Their snacks are always the best on San Bruno ! Takoyaki, fish ball, and popcorn chicken are my favorite! I suggest everyone to try in store not online, no reason. Just go in store. You will have better experience!
author: Yanxin C.

description: Takes my orders wrong 60% of the time, the drinks are either too sweet or too bland, even when I specify the sweetness level. Takes 40 minutes( not an exaggeration) to make ONE drink. 'nuff said.
author: David L.

description: Good late night tea and snack spot near the house.  It has done us right on each occasion.  Needs some interior cleaning but the teas and food are great. Employees are friendly and the owner is as well.
author: Pedro N.

description: Nvm! I dn't hv 2 give good compliments for them. The first services they gave us, yes! It was good! But these next visits! Nvm! I was wrong. So I changed my good compliments and reviews to a zero!
author: Anne T.

description:
Saturday night, 10 PM. Just got back from snowboarding in Tahoe. This is the only Boba spot still open within mine & the boyfriend's vicinity. 

1 worker, all tables full but no one has any drinks. Is this a sign? Everyone is on their phone yet here I am waiting 28 minutes to order. A few more minutes, he says. The worker goes back and forth from the back to the front making no drinks or eye contact with anyone. He comes back again, apologizes for the wait and says, "few more minutes."

I'm waiting. Pretty sure this is the place for everyone to just walk in, take a seat, use the free wifi and sit for hours doing nothing but play games or be on their phones. On the bright side, they have the Costco version of Jenga and some games for little kids. They also play music on a TV screen. But still, it's pretty cramped in here. 

10:31. Finally put my order in. Green apple green tea with boba light ice, 50% sweet. Thai milk tea, light ice with boba. Lychee slush with boba.

While waiting, I decided to look around.. in the spot I'm standing in -since the establishment is pretty small and all seats were taken by boys on their phones. The egg puff machine was dripping with old batter, on the sides and the table. You can see in the back where they keep everything, in plain sight, that all of their boxes are stacked from the floor to the ceiling. 

I feel bad for this worker. Why is there only one person working? 2/5 because he made the effort to make the drinks diligently and as quickly as possible. The green apple drink tasted disgusting. Couldn't taste the apple at all. To check I asked my boyfriend and one other person to try it without telling them the flavor. They couldn't figure it out. Their guesses were not even close to apple. The lychee slush was tasty, you could definitely taste the lychee but 3 quick sips and I hit ice. It was practically ice with lychee syrup... so disappointing. Wasn't to thrilled to try the Thai milk tea, but honestly, how could anyone mess that up?

I also saw the worker grab the lid for the blender straight out of the sink without washing it. Suffice to say, I hope the couple who came after me just threw out that drink without trying it. Wasn't sure how to tell them as I wasn't sure if they'd understand me... they were speaking a dialect I'd never heard before.

First & last try. Will probably wait for the next day if I get another Boba craving. Avoiding this place at all costs.
author: Shilo B.

description:
Tea Plus is my favorite of the three boba tea shops within a few blocks on San Bruno. The service has been reliable, they have a variety of snacks, and everything is reasonably priced. They even have a small seating area that usually has some room open.

The food and tea is okay. In my experience the egg puffs are made fine but they're not outstanding, and the milk tea is indeed a little weak in the tea area - on the upside, they're particular here about how much ice and sweetness you want, and I always ask them to keep it down to 25% sweet. That's fairly sweet so I'd hate to know how the 100% comes out.

Like most shops around here, they're cash only and only open until eight. They also get overwhelmed easily so you might not want to head here right after the schools let out. If you're in the area often, also check out 5 tea house which is only a couple of doors over and very similar - better or worse depending on who you ask.
author: Jesse C.

description:
Intro- hesitantly gives it one star
A simple night out, smoking a backwood in Portola with some bruvs of mine, turned oh so dark oh so quickly. We took sanctuary in this animated establishment, but don't let there facade fool you my friends, they are void of all flavor, and there sauce, is weak. Inside this weakness, is where my friends and I lost our sanity. 
We arrived hurriedly home, with a feast of potstickers, fries, 2 crepes, mozzerella sticks, onion rings, and a box of mochi( mochi was right) and soon were forced into insanity by there absolutely awful flavör. 
   My 2 compadres and I lined out opposing trajectories with our handy civil war cannons, and lit them simultaneously at one another. My friend being the jokester that he is, filled one cannon with confetti instead of a lead ball, and left I, as the lone survivor. I scrambled to hide there bodies, and more importantly the remains of such awful food. I went to the bay to dispose of the remains, but was greeted by two hungry pigs...police officers I mean. They demanded I give them my food, I pleaded for them not to take a bite... but they hungrily 
Abused there power and scarfed the food... soon to be driven to madness and forced to take There own lives by shooting pepper spray lodged into there brown eye... I tried to save them... 

So at this point I have 4 body's. 

No snacks that won't caused homicide,

And very little Patience. 

I ended up donating the bodies to a local Korean BBQ place and getting A ton of i store credit- so not all bad. 

But regardless this food caused a quadruple homicide and is just, so not with the litness. 

Plz, never go here
author: Izaac Z.

description:
I really like the mango and honeydew egg puffs here ($3.25 +tax) because it's really bread-y and crispy. I usually get a regular oolong milk tea ($2.50) which are slightly hit-or-miss because sometimes the sweetness to tea ratio are off and show my student ID for a size upgrade. I don't get tapioca here because it's not sweet. The snack box here is an amazing deal at $3.99 for a packed take-out box of fried goodness!

The popcorn chicken that they serve is the same store bought frozen stuff so I don't recommend it at all. I've also tried the lavendar milk tea which I do not recommend.

Bottom line: great if you just come for the egg puffs, snack box, and affordable milk tea!
author: Erica S.

description: Do not order through Grubhub. Not once have they gotten my complete order right. They forget the add ons or get the wrong one. I let the first time go because I'm not one to complain about $1.00 but it keeps happening. Thankfully Grubhub has refunded me for the mistakes but it sucks to have to wait that long only to get the wrong order. I probably will refrain from ordering delivery from now on.
author: Marissa C.

description: Good place to satisfy milk tea/tea cravings. They have a deal where you can get up to two other free toppings if you order at least a medium size which is an awesome deal! I'll have to admit the place is not the most aesthetically pleasing. A plus is that you can customize sweetness and ice level!
author: Angelina W.

description: They open at crazy late hours considering there's nothing much around in the neighborhood after 9pm. This ratings only for the snacks, I ordered for their housemade popcorn chicken and spam masubi. Came out to be roughly $8. Service was super friendly but I didn't really enjoy either of their snacks. The popcorn chicken batter wasn't too thick (which i liked) but it was very very salted. The spam came out lukewarm, felt like it was sitting around for a long time..
author: Angela L.

description:
Really like the staff here. Boba is decent. Prices are good. We come here often and I appreciate how late they're open.  

Right now they're doing 3 free toppings with a medium drink which is pretty fun because you can try out a lot of combos. On Saturdays they have those baked fish shape deserts with ice cream.
author: Matthew B.

description: They have really good curry fish ball. Spicy Level1 to 5. If u love spicy come and try it.
author: Ella L.

description: Came here while waiting for a haircut. Asked the guy at the counter what was in the Royal Rose garden. He said it was a secret but it's mainly Rose tea and other flavors. He was honest and pretty funny. I ordered it just to try. 50% sweet, 25% ice, no boba, add aloe. It was good. Not too sweet and refreshing just what the guy said. It's on par with tfm's version. This one may be better.... Will come back again :)
author: Martha L.

description: Ordered on postmates and the food was still warm. I ordered chicken wings which was so fat, literally every bite had fat in it. GROSS. Then I also ordered egg puffs, it was so sweet and hard it tasted like I was eating puffed up sugar they are also burnt!
author: Ruby F.

description: If you like spicy, try their spicy curry fish balls, ask for level 5 spicy. Good food.....
author: Edmond T.

description:
I order from this place on Postmates a lot, and the only issues I've ever had is with the crepes. I'll order a crepe with an add on, and the add on won't be there.
Other than that though, absolutely no complaints. They have the absolute best mango milk tea with boba I've ever had in my life. Would definetly recommend it!
author: Julie K.

description:
This is the second time I've been here. The first time, my boyfriend and I got lavender and Thai milk tea. The lavender was very good, but the Thai runs a little on the sweet side which I liked. 

This time we ordered rose milk tea. It was pretty fragrant and you definitely got the rose flavor. However, I still prefer lavender. We also ordered the takoyaki, thai style and regular spam musubi. The takoyaki was very good and they were generous with the toppings. The spam musubis had more sauce than most others. The Thai style was more crispy and the difference was subtle from the regular in terms of flavor

Something to consider when ordering food is the wait time. The drinks were ready quickly, but took at least 20 minutes for the food. Though, It was understandable as a rush came in as we were ordering
author: Alexandra B.

description:
Incredibly slow. Tried to order something over Uber east. Ended up being delayed over an hour   because of delays at the restaurant.  0 stars 0 stars. 

Probably shouldn't list on Uber if you can't fill the demand.
author: David T.

description:
Ehhh. I'm not sure yet.  The boy and I decided to come here after picking up some lunch and noticed this place was new. 

We decided to give it a shot. He tried the 1.99 milk tea and I supposedly tried the coconut milk tea...but they gave me the same thing as my boyfriend just in a larger cup... 

We also decided to try the egg puffs.  The worker messed up the first one, which was fine, we were patient and understanding, but the second one was very thick.  They're still learning quite a bit. Our egg puffs were very thick, she had added too much batter, so instead of being "puffy" they were doughy. I ended up liking the texture more as it kind of tasted a bit like an egg custard, but regardless it wasn't a puff. 

We'll give them another shot.  Maybe try the coconut again and see if it's better the next time or if it really just tastes as plain as a regular milk tea. 

This place is in a convenient spot for us as we live close by, but always willing to farther for happier drinks. :(
author: Jay K.

description:
Out of all the other boba shops in this particular area, I think this one is the best. I have been here twice so far and the second time I bought drinks for my family too and they all liked it. We agreed that our drinks did not taste powdery and the tapioca pearls were soft, yet chewy - great consistency. Both of my drinks (from different days) had popping boba. I've tried the mango and strawberry one so far and they were both really tasty. I'm glad that they offer it because I've become obsessed with popping boba lately.

I also noticed that they have the machines that shake the drinks which I realize not many boba establishments have and for the ones that don't, the workers don't even shake the drinks like they're supposed to. I think this is why the drinks here taste fresh.

I ordered their spam musubis too and it was super flavorful. My sister ordered spam musubis at that 5 Degree or whatever spot nearby (it's also a boba spot) and it didn't even have any sauce!

If anything, this place is way better than that Panda one down the street. Last time I got a drink there, it didn't taste like the flavor that I ordered! In fact, I couldn't even pin point WHAT the flavor was. Bleh. Please do yourself a favor and go to Tea Plus instead!
author: Krystal C.

description: First of all, when I walked into this boba spot, it was nasty, DIRTY af, sticky. I needed to use the restroom so I did, but on my way there , there was so many garbage and nasty ass things in the back of the store. When I ordered my drink , it tasted like medicine. I wasn't feeling the drink at all. And I ordered egg puffs. So the guy left to go use the bathroom and when came out, it look like he didn't even wash his hands . And my egg puff was done so he was taking it out with his hands. HIS HANDS! I was so gross out, I didn't want to eat it anymore. SO NEVER EVER COME TO THIS PLACE AGAIN. ALSO HIS FLOORS WERE VERY STICKY. NASTY ASS PLACE. CLEAN YO SHIT BOIII
author: Carl V.

description: Awful service. The girl didn't know what she was doing and when I complained that my tea was undrinkable she refused to do anything. I honestly think Ive just been going here bc it's close to my house and open until midnight, but their drinks really don't taste good. Just go next door, milk tea is better there.
author: Laura W.

description: This place is on the same block as the 5 Tea House and Pho No. 1, across from the O'Reilly Auto Parts store on San Bruno. It's pretty comparable to the tea house - wide selection of milk teas, boba drinks, and smoothies, same small sitting area, cash only. Their saving grace is that they're open a half hour later than the tea house, so it's easier to still catch them if you're having dinner at one of the nearby restaurants.
author: Rod V.

description:
Ordered the Oolong Milk Tea (less sweet) with tapioca and Taro Milk Tea with tapioca. For the Oolong, even with less sweet, it wasn't as strong as I hoped it would be and tasted just a bit watered down. Got the Taro for my brother and he said it was too much powder but otherwise tasted fine. Tapioca was soft and chewy so we both liked it.

This place just opened up recently (I can still smell the paint and it's not quite furnished yet) but hopefully this place will get better with time as I have seen other Milk Tea places have done. I will revisit again and see if deserves some more stars.
author: John Y.

description:
Gave this place a few shots before I judge. The milk tea taste nothing like tea. All I taste are sugar, milk, and ice. 

The egg puffs are barely cooked through. There is still dough in the middle. 

I live around here and i it's just too bad that there's no decent Tapioca place around this thriving neighborhood. You have to really drive to Sunset and Richmond district for a decent cup of tapioca, bubble tea, bobo, etc. Location is and decor is good but not the what matters, the drinks/foods.
author: U L.

description:
Super not satisfied with the service and the drinks that I ordered. There was no other customer in the store beside us. It took the serve almost 5 min to make 2 drinks. Beside, I  ordered a toffee assam milk tea with 50% sweetness. I ended up with toffee assam tea probably with 90% sweetness, it was super sweet almost like drinking pure simple syrup
For the milk tea, they used coffee mate to mix with tea ,and it had a wafer after taste. Coffee mate is only taste good with coffee not with tea.
So we ended up throw away both drinks after 1 slip. What a wasted of $7.
author: Stacy L.

description: Very clean and well run establishment. Their Boba Teas taste very refreshing and not so "whatever". Very reasonably priced and the new creation I just discovered the TAIYAKI ! It's like a mix of a crepe and an ice cream sandwich, and it's pretty amazing ! Must try, never seen anyone do it like them before.
author: shadi a.

description: OMG I ordered through GRUBHUB and got my order within 30 minutes when it told me they will arrive in an hour. Once I got my order I was very pleased. Never ordered here before. I love their Thai tea, better than what I am used. I also ordered french fries and egg puffs and I loved all my snacks. I am definitely going to order from here again.
author: Kim C.

description: best boba near me. I order at least once a week. I enjoy the basic milk tea and when you want fresh taro, bam, they got it. I've never had a problem with the service, and the store is super chill.
author: Lex W.

description: Slightly dirty inside, but at least in the neighborhood, this is the norm. Nonetheless, I enjoyed my Thai ice tea, and would come here again. The prices for the drinks are definitely reasonable too.
author: Henry L.

description: Twice I ordered from here on Uber Eats and I was missing orders. Tonight drew the line. Last time I ordered from here I was missing a drink order which was my girlfriend's drink. I was very disappointed as was she. She was looking forward to enjoying her almond milk tea. They STILL charged us for the drink. Uber Eats apologized, gave me a refund on the drink only and a $5 comp on my next purchase. So tonight I wanted to give it another shot since I gave a $5 comp. I might as well use it right? So then I place another order with Tea Plus and once again, I'm missing an order. They had the decency to not charge me for the missing order. But still, ruined my night. I was looking forward to enjoying a Honeydew Egg Puff that I hear is delicious. I will never give this place my time and my business. Too bad for them because I could have been a regular customer here. Now they lost my business. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND that everyone else not continue business with this place since they don't care to fulfill the easiest part in customer service. Ensuring their orders are sound.
author: Rich D.

description:
After eating lunch at Hoy Sun, I noticed that there were two boba places across the street. I couldn't leave San Bruno Ave. without getting a drink. 

There was one place called 5 degrees and one called Tea Plus. I chose to go into Tea Plus because they had a promotion banner in front of their store for $0.99 regular Milk Tea. For such a deal, I had to go in and try this new place. I ordered two Regular Milk Teas, one with boba and one without. Boba costs $0.50 extra. Tea Plus is fast. The drinks came out in like 20 seconds. 

Judging by the taste, I would compare it to Quickly's but this place is better because their sugar level is appropriate. Quickly's often makes their drinks way too sweet, like I'm consuming sugar cubes. 

I would come back and order other drinks.
author: Regina L.

description: This is your local mom-and-pop milk tea store. You won't get any frills or fancy agar boba here, but you also won't get any nonsense either. They do snacks like fries, takoyaki, and Thai spam musubis. You're getting what you pay for at about $3 a drink. It's syrup with their house tea, and you can customize the sweetness level. Customer service here is really good, which makes me want to come back, but the drinks are just so-so. The tea flavor isn't super fragrant, but because you can adjust sweetness, you'll get something that won't just taste like syrup and powder. Really nice people working here though. They have free wifi and take credit cards, which is more than what you get at a lot of boba places.
author: Danny C.

description: Tried this place for the first time today. A staff took my drink order and got my sweetness and ice level incorrectly, but luckily I caught it before they prepared my order because I asked for a receipt. I recommend asking for a receipt with your order to verify the correctness of your order. When I got my drink, they forgot the boba. The staff was pretty apologetic and did replace my drink with boba. Lastly, I ordered an egg puff. It took a little longer than expected, but again the staff were apologetic about the wait. The egg puff needs significant improvement. Parts of it came out flat, but more importantly - every bite had a bitter taste to it. The batter needs improvement. I couldn't eat it and had to toss it.
author: Marilyn L.

description:
This place is a hit or miss... I've been here like 5 times and sometimes the tea is too bitter for my taste. However, I do prefer the tea here over 5 degree because it's not made of powder like the tea at 5 degree. 

I only give 3 stars because today I waited like 40 minutes for 2 drinks and I ended up taking someone else's drink because the girl kept assuring me it was regular milk tea when earlier she said it was lavender LOL. ALSO DO NOT ORDER THE SMOOTHIES!!! I got a strawberry smoothie here and it tasted like pure crap that got diluted with water, poured into the toilet, and scooped back up into a cup. forever ragrets.
author: Yvon T.

description: Super watery avocado smoothie , I hate it . I would always come here & they usually make it a thick consistency. Not this time .
author: Zabrina B.

description: My girlfriend and I have been coming here since the first day they opened. Although there are a few other boba spots nearby, this one never disappoints. They have the best milk tea in my honest opinion, and their tapioca balls are always the perfect taste and texture. They are still fairly new, and there always seems to be new employees like every day so the service can be pretty slow when it starts to get busy. The owner is very accomadating, he is serious about customer satisfaction! I have never encountered an owner/manager who cared so much about making the customer happy but his ever-changing employees don't carry the same mentality... Which is fine by me because I will still keep coming back for their delicious jasmine milk tea! Yumm!
author: Gabriela M.

description: Great spot for boba! They brewed the tea fresh for my strawberry black tea and let me control the sweetness. Will definitely come back to try the peach oolong tea.
author: Tysen C.

description: Went there twice this week. The first time was too sweet. Today I asked for less sugar and it tastes really good. If you like agar, you should definitely order here.
author: Odie K.

description:
The last 3 times I've been here I have felt greatly ripped off on my toppings--not all of them though! Boba is always a hefty amount and I greatly enjoy it. But why when I order agar, which I also pay more for, I only get 1/3 the amount that I would have gotten if I ordered regular boba? It has been like that consistently! And it's my only gripe because I love toppings in my drink and this just doesn't really count when it just reaches the very first bottom indent of the cup. 

I'm done with my toppings before I'm even half way on my drink. Please put more toppings in--or be consistent with the amount so I'll know if I need to order double toppings 

But the jasmine is still one of the best around
author: Thuy M.

description: Yet the best milk in the area. This grand opening milk tea store provides great milk tea. Prices are fair and the qualities are good. Will definitely recommend to the neighborhood.
author: Lena P.

description: I LOVE this place and I go after school all the time! However, I wish they would clean more. But I love the thi ice tea it's my fave.
author: Raven S.

description: Ordered delivery via Postmates as this was the only place open late on a Monday night, and my boyfriend and I were desperate for sweets. The delivery arrived in a timely matter, but everything was gross. The milk teas (honey and almond) were ridiculously sweet even though we requested 50% sweetness. Boba was hard and unappetizing. The crepe batter had a very doughy texture (how can you mess up a crepe?!), but the filling was fine. We didn't feel to well after eating our crepes anyway (serious munchies), and will probably not order from here again.
author: Alison L.

description: I came here out of curiosity to try their milk tea, so obviously I had to get the Oolong milk tea with grass jelly. The milk tea tasted more like a roasted milk tea than oolong/: grass jelly was alright, starting to have a tummy ache though. So I'm not too sure how long the grass jelly has been in that can or container D: Overall it was meh. Probably won't come back.
author: Tracy V.

description: What I really like about this place is the quality of their ingredients they are so damn fresh. Their mango smoothie had real mango chunks which means acutal fruit is in there not just an artificial flavoring or a puree. Also I am obsessed with their Thai tea not sure what they do different but it's the best I've had. Their avacado smoothie is amazing so if you like avacado I definitely recommend trying that. As far as service goes they are really fast the gentleman who I think is the owner is always very nice and personable. I have never once had to deal with attitude from the people that work their so thanks for that!
author: Ashley R.

description: I really love the Spam Musubi, Milk Tea with Boba and Thai Mango Sticky Rice at this place. Great customer service, cheap price and the quality food is really delicious. The place is clean and comfortable, good place to hang out with group of friends. Love it so much!
author: Olive C.

description: Good drinks for a good price. Ordered oolong milk tea for $2. Will come back again for their delicious teas.
author: Paul C.

description: Probably one of the worst milk teas that I have ever tasted. The customer before me complained that her order tasted watered down. The cashier responded saying, "You chose 25% sweetness" so I thought perhaps her drink just didn't have enough sweetness added to it. When I took a sip of my oolong milk tea, my exact thoughts were, "watered down". It's not that the drink lacked sweetness, it simply lacked flavor. Not enough tea flavor so even if they were to add some more sugar to it, it'd just taste like sugar water. Take your buck a few stores up if you want decent milk tea.
author: M W.

description: Great store and great ownership. Uses real tea (not powder) and just an amazing place overall.
author: Marlene F.

description: Came here on a friends recommendation. I got my baseline test drink, jasmine milk tea with lychee jelly, and it was perfectly made. Even with the lychee jelly, it was not overly sweet. I've tried the few other places around the area and you will definitely notice the difference in the tea. Can't beat the taste of fresh brewed tea. Give it a shot and see the difference for yourself.
author: W L.

description: This is my first time here and I had the worst customer experience. I asked them if I could sample the almond milk tea since I didn't know if the almond was too strong for my liking and they said with attitude towards their coworkers "we don't do samples, why won't she just buy the whole drink... How the heck are we supposed to make a sample?" They spoke in Chinese thinking I couldn't understand. Never coming back here again. Would not recommend.
author: Melanie N.

description: Ordered 3 drinks, Thai tea with Boba, milk tea with Boba and grass jelly, and oolong milk tea with grass jelly, and an egg puff through grub hub for delivery. But there were no grass jelly in our drinks and the egg puff looks like plastic. All we can taste from the drinks is syrup. Never again will I order from this place.
author: Tiffany Q.

description: Ordered a regular size Jasmine Milk tea with grass jelly, took them more than five minutes to find out they ran out of grass jelly; then changed to egg pudding, sorry, they don't have that either. Then waited at least another three minutes to get my drink with no toppings and no refund on not getting my toppings. Very disappointed overall.
author: Shu Z.

description:
One of my strangest experiences...

When I went up to the front register, the cashiers there didn't came over. I think the young girl cashier is trying to teach a new guy near the boba machine next to the register. Maybe they were just focus didn't notice me? So, I tried to grab their attention. Eye contact, hand waving, waving in front of the boba machine, saying hello... I can tell they are busy, but please just give me a nod, a "we will be with you soon" - something! But no, they never once even look up!

Thankful, an adult came out from the back. He immediately came over and took my order. He was very polite. Sadly, he passed the transaction to the new guy - I was pretty sure he was new by then, seeing the intensely focused face and slow finger movement as he navigate the iPad register. After purchase, I realized he charged me wrong. I ordered a rose milk with mango popping boba. He charged me for rose milk tea, popping boba, and boba. *Sigh* By that point, I was tired. I was not going to make a scene against a newbie cashier for $0.50.

Before I left, the older guy apologize again for the wait and even help me get my straw. I was hoping that my experience ends there, with the polite old guy and two young cashiers new to customer service, but no.

It was the first time in my life that a milk tea taste sour. No kidding! The rose is so barely there that, the moment I got home, I asked my sister if she can taste it. Being a much more frequent boba drinker than I am, she told me it's just very light. Then, she frowned, and she commented that it taste very strange. Finally, she asked me if I can be sure it hasn't gone bad.

I was so surprise by the taste that I didn't even consider that. But I was so thirsty that I already drink half of it (yes, I was that thirsty), and I wasn't sick. She finally proposed that maybe the syrup that the boba soak in didn't got drain out properly. After some thought, I wondered if some mango popping boba was popped while the drink was made, though the mango wasn't strong and shouldn't taste sour... Who knows what happened? But geeze... this is one strange, strange experience. 

The drink by itself should have got this down to 2 star. The lack of attention from cashiers would downgrade it to 1. The only reason it is 2 is because the polite and pleasant behavior from the older guy and the fact that the store and its cashiers are obviously still new.
author: Amy C.

description: No more going to Super Cue to get my peach green tea with AGAR JELLY craving. I repeat, AGAR JELLY!!!!!!!!!
author: Liping H.

description: Finally found something in my area to go to. Drinks are good and not sweet like other places and the boba is fresh.
author: Millie M.

description: I love their green apple green tea!!! It's really good !!!!But regular milk tea is s bit too sweet... If they could have few more tables, friends can sit around eating drinking, that would be great
author: Sue C.

description: Peach oolong tea was pretty good if you like fruity flavors. The milk tea is alright. Definitely try the free sample flavors before you order.
author: Joy Y.

description: So this was my go to place, and there's always something wrong. But today I think I just had it. Only because I was the only customer and I ordered 2 drinks. Honey lemon tea, how hard is it to make that? I waited almost 15 mins before she gave me my drinks. Just because you're not busy doesn't mean take all the time in the world to make a drink that ended up tasting really bad! Panda boba, is always busy but yet I never have to wait that long for what I want.
author: Denise N.

description: I purchased a regular lychee green tea with lychee coconut jelly and a large popcorn chicken, $8.18 for both. The level of sweetness is just right. Wish they would have given more jelly, but I won't complain. Nothing special about the drink. I was originally going to go to 5 degree next door, but they didn't have popcorn chicken. I would suggest people not get popcorn chicken though. It's not that flavorful. Kind of reminds me of chicken strips or whatever from McDonald's. I added a lot of chili pepper, but it wasn't spicy at all either. I can't handle spicy too well, but it isn't spicy at all. I ate the egg puffs before, but it was really doughy (totally not what 鸡蛋子 is supposed to taste like). But I guess there are some people who like this doughy texture? Next time, I'll purchase drinks here (price is good), but I'll purchase the snacks elsewhere. Unless I hear that they've improved on their egg puff making skills! And hopefully some better chili pepper!
author: Rose G.

description: Delicious food! Great customer service! Workers are really nice! Delicious food and drinks! The food varies in flavor for example their egg puffs comes in green tea, chocolate,mango,etc!!! The drinks are really delicious and if you like it a certain way you can just tell them!
author: Manh N.
